parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method requires user authentication .

parameters.name: image_file
parameters.description: The image file upload, OR :

parameters.name: image_url
parameters.description: A URL from which to retrieve the image file.

parameters.name: caption
parameters.description: A caption for this image. (optional)

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method controls access via authentication .

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the venue to use as the feed source.

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method requires user authentication .

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The performer ID. Required

parameters.name: link
parameters.description: The link url being added. Required

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the link being added. Optional

parameters.name: link_type_id
parameters.description:
The type of link being added. Corresponds to one of the follow values. Required 1 Info
2 Office
3 News
4 Review
5 Sponsor
6 Tickets
8 Chat
14 Webcast
15 Blog
16 Other
17 Official Site
18 Podcast
19 Website
20 Wiki
21 MySpace
22 Ringtone
23 Facebook
24 Official Tickets
25 Twitter

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method requires user authentication .

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The event ID.

parameters.name: image_id
parameters.description: The image ID. (See /events/get to list the image IDs for an event.)

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method controls access via authentication .

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The search keywords. (optional)

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: A location name to use in filtering the search results. Locations in the form "San Diego", "San Diego, TX", "London, United Kingdom", and "Calgary, Alberta, Canada" are accepted. (optional)

parameters.name: count_only
parameters.description: If count_only is set, an abbreviated version of the output will be returned. Only total_items and search_time elements are included in the result. (optional)

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The desired number of results per "page". (optional)

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: The desired "page" number. (optional)

parameters.name: within
parameters.description: If within is set and the "location" parameter resolves to a specific geolocation, the search will be restricted to the specified radius. If the "location" parameter does not resolve to a specific location, this parameter is ignored. (optional)

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: One of "mi" or "km", the units of the "within" parameter. Defaults to "mi". (optional)

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: One of 'popularity', 'relevance', or 'venue_name'. Default is 'relevance'. (optional)

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: One of 'ascending' or 'descending'. Default varies by sort_order. (optional)

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method requires user authentication .

parameters.name: link_id
parameters.description: The ID of the link to be deleted.

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method requires user authentication .

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event to which this link is being added.

parameters.name: link
parameters.description: The URL of the link. (e.g. "http://foo.com")

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The title of the link. (e.g. "Foo Laboratories") (optional)

parameters.name: link_type_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the link type, as found in this list: ID Link Type
15 Blog
2 Box Office
8 Chat
23 Facebook
1 Info
21 Myspace
3 News
17 Official Site
18 Podcast
4 Review
5 Sponsor
6 Tickets
14 Webcast
19 Website
20 Wiki
16 Other

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method does require user authentication .

parameters.name: subcategories
parameters.description: Optional - set to 1 to get subcategory information back.

parameters.name: aliases
parameters.description: Optional - set to 1 to get category aliases back in the results.

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method controls access via authentication .

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the performer.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The page_size (number of events) to be returned (defaults to 10).

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: The page number of events to be returned (defaults to 1) .

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method requires the usual authentication arguments.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: A space-delimited list of tags. Tags with spaces should be enclosed in quotes (e.g. "San Diego").

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event from which these tags are being deleted.

parameters.description: This method requires user authentication .

parameters.description: The event ID.

parameters.name: category_id
parameters.description: The category ID. (See /categories/list for a list of available categories.)

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method requires user authentication .

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The user id from which to delete the locale.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The name of the locale to delete.

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method controls access via authentication .

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The source of the external ids (facebook ids should be fb_uid) for other providers please contact eventful to see if we support them.

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method controls access via authentication .

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The search keywords. (optional)

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: A location name to use in filtering the search results. Locations in the form "San Diego", "San Diego, TX", "London, United Kingdom", and "Calgary, Alberta, Canada" are accepted, as are postal codes ("92122"). Full addresses ("1 Infinite Loop, Cupertino, CA") and common geocoordinate formats ("32.746682, -117.162741") are also accepted, but the "within" parameter is recommended in order to set a search radius. (optional)

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Limit this list of results to the specified date range. Date ranges are specified by label. Currently supported labels include: "All", "Future", "Past", "Today", "Last Week", "This Week", "Next week", and months by name, e.g. "October". (optional)

parameters.name: within
parameters.description: If within is set and the "location" parameter resolves to a specific geolocation, the search will be restricted to the specified radius. If the "location" parameter does not resolve to a specific location, this parameter is ignored. (optional)

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: One of "mi" or "km", the units of the "within" parameter. Defaults to "mi". (optional)

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: One of 'popularity', 'date', 'title', 'relevance', or 'venue_name'. Default is 'date'. (optional)

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: One of 'ascending' or 'descending'. Default varies by sort_order. (optional)

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The desired number of results per page. Default: 50, Maximum: 50. (optional)

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method requires user authentication .

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the venue to which this link is being added.

parameters.name: link
parameters.description: The URL of the link. (e.g. "http://foo.com")

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The title of the link. (e.g. "Foo Laboratories") (optional)

parameters.name: link_type_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the link type, as found in this list: ID Link Type

parameters.description: This method requires user authentication .

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The venue ID to modify.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The displayed name for this venue. (optional)

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The street address of the venue. (optional)

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The city name. (optional)

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: The name of the region (state, province, county) (optional)

parameters.name: postal_code
parameters.description: The postal code or ZIP code. (optional)

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The name of the country.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The venue description. (optional)

parameters.name: privacy
parameters.description: The privacy setting for this venue. (1 = public, 2 = private, 3 = semi-private) (optional)

parameters.name: venue_type

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method controls access via authentication .

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the event to index.

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method requires user authentication .

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The event title.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: The event start time in ISO 8601 format (e.g. "2005-03-01T19:00:00") or a readable alternative (e.g. "2005-03-01 19:00:00"). See the W3C Note on Date and Time formats for examples or RFC3339 for more detail. Note that if offset information is specified here (e.g. "2005-03-01T19:00:00-04:00"), the time will be converted to UTC. The preferred method of specifying the time zone is via the tz_olson_path parameter (below).

parameters.name: stop_time
parameters.description: The event stop time, if any, in ISO 8601 format (see above). (optional)

parameters.name: tz_olson_path
parameters.description: The event timezone, as listed in the Olson timezones database (e.g. "America/New_York") (optional)

parameters.name: all_day
parameters.description: True ("1") if the event is an all-day event, false ("0") otherwise. (optional)

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The event description. (optional)

parameters.name: privacy
parameters.description: The privacy setting for this event. (1 = public, 2 = private, 3 = semi-private) (optional, defaults to 1)

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: A space-delimited list of tags. (optional)

parameters.name: free
parameters.description: True ("1") if the event is free, false ("0") otherwise. (optional)

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: A text string describing the event price. For example, this could indicate a price range ("$15 - $35"), free but donations requested ("$10 donation suggested"), or other special instructions ("Adults $15, children under eight $5"). Don't pass this parameter or leave it blank if there is no price information. (optional)

parameters.name: venue_id
parameters.description: The ID of the venue where this event occurs. Use /venues/new or /venues/search retrieve an appropriate ID. required

parameters.name: parent_id
parameters.description: The ID of this event's parent event. (optional)
